newsitem.title: FRANCE: French CFDT union says shipyard stoppages Thursday.
newsitem.headline: French CFDT union says shipyard stoppages Thursday.

text.p: France's Socialist CFDT union said on Tuesday further short strikes had been called for Thursday at naval shipyards in a follow-up to stoppages on September 10.
"After the nationwide action of September 10, staff at the shipyards will be back in action after a call from their union federations," a CFDT statement said.
Stoppages of one to two hours have been called for at naval yards in Brest, Lorient, Cherbourg, Indret, Ruelle and Toulon.
The strikes are part of protests against cuts in the defence sector and plans that could mean employment location moves for staff under a labour mobility programme.
